caption.title: Lake temperature modeling process.
caption.p: Schematic of the process used to create models of lake surface temperature and predicted future thermal conditions of southern Rocky Mountain lakes. Input variables are shown in ovals and the model of surface temperature and model output are in rectangles. Thermal metrics include the warmest 30-day running mean of daily mean water temperature (M30AT), the mean annual surface temperature (MAT), the mean summer surface water temperature (MST), and number of ice-free days (IFD). The gray polygon in B indicates upper and lower bounds of the predictions derived from uncertainty analysis (see Materials and Methods).
